page.title: 10WATER MAIN, CUCKFIELD RURAL
page.content: This year the Mid Sussex Water Company has had a new water main laid from Pilstye Farm to Butlers Green Resevoir, Haywards Heath. The land was surveyed by M.J.Zara Associates of Lewes. This trunk main will eventually be joined to the Ardingly Resevoir. R. E. Docwra of Hatfield, Middlesex, the company employed on the work is the oldest mains laying contractors in the country. Twelve of their men took four months to lay the 5km of 400mm ductile lined pressure main. The cost of the operation was Â£350,000. A pumping station is to be built at Pilstye Farm and water will be pumped either way along the main to boost the water pressure where it is most needed.
